jobDescription: Title Credit Data and Reporting Analyst DescriptionSummary This position is responsible for designing, developing and maintaining business data, reporting, and statistical models which allow for insights into loan data and lending portfolio risk trends. Candidate would be expected to complete research and analyze data within the markets the bank services, including existing portfolios and new oppurtunites.  The individual will need a deep understanding of analytical techniques and tools and it is helpful to have a strong understanding of lending practices and processes.  Analyzes credit data to estimate degree of risk involved in extending credit or lending money to firms or individuals by performing the following duties. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.  Conduct research and compare to existing and planned portfolio characteristics, through multiple internal and external sources.  Analyze complex and large customer loan data sets for use with evolving statistical methods (i.e. lending stress testing, concentration analysis,  Allowance of Loans and lease Loss (forthcoming CECL) reporting), identifying and reporting on risk trends.  Formulate narrative, analytics reporting and credit risk analysis of lending programs in presentation form.  Enhance report and dash boards through data mining analytics and internal reporting tools, following departmental standards, presenting information and  solutions to management and the Board of Directors.  Participate simultaneously on multiple work efforts and high priority activities.  Maximize the use of manual and automated technology to achieve the highest level of data integrity, while producing quality reporting metrics in support of multiple financial systems.  Provide support for the lending projects including re-developing data feeds, data improvement and documentation, development and evidence of lending portfolio management.  Ongoing date improvement and developing from changing date.  Stay well informed about lending practices and procedures throughout the industry.
